quote: 通过构建健壮的、实用性强的 web app，不仅增强了我的信心，还向潜在的雇主显示了我的能力。每一项对我来说都是成功，可以让我找到满意的工作。
我曾给自己设定目标，要在2015年的年底前找到工作，最终我在2015年的年初就找到了工作，这直接得益于我在 Free Code Camp 所学到的知识和技能。
现在我得到了实习的机会。在 IT 领域我没有什么经验，但是现在我的好运来了！
我以 web 开发零基础开始学习 Free Code Camp，6 个月后，作为后端工程师，我得到了我的第一份工作。
为非赢利项目所做的工作，让我有机会学习如何构建 Chrome 扩展，并给了我展示自己全栈开发者技能的平台。
当我把 Free Code Camp 添加到我的履历和 LinkedIn 后，我有了越来越多的工作联系。
在我为 Free Code Camp 的非赢利项目工作期间，我在国外找到了一个 MEAN 栈职位，现在我在布达佩斯工作。
Free Code Camp 帮助我得到了我的第一份工程师工作。这个神奇的社区让我的工作变得更加轻松、有趣。
Free Code Camp 为像我这样的残疾退伍军人提供了一条非常好的接受再教育的途径。即使现在我还没学完课程，我已经得到了工程师工作的 offer。
在花了大量的时间尝试不同的编程教学网站后我才发现，FreeCodeCamp 从一开始就是那么地与众不同。他们为不同水平的每个人都提供了最好、最多的用于学习编程并创建神奇的、适销的作品集的条理清晰的途径。
当我获得计算机科学硕士学位并毕业后，我无法把我的任何代码分享给雇主（大学政策：害怕协助作弊）。使用 FreeCodeCamp，我能够开发一个小型的作品集。
我正在做一项把 JavaScript 整合到 FileMaker 的工作，同时在为某校区做一些定制 web 发布的工作，我也得到了 Apple 和另外几家科技公司的 offer。如果不是 Free Code Camp，我现在仍然带着一身棒棒的但却无关紧要的技能在黑暗中摸索呢。
相比之前，我现在泡在 Free Code Camp 上的时间少了，因为已经有人开始雇我做项目了。Free Code Camp 为我提供了得到这些工作的基础知识。
在我开始 Free Code Camp 的学习之前，对于人们问我“会写代码吗？”这样的问题，我会感到非常紧张。现在，我会非常自信地回答“会！”
即使你像我一样拥有计算机科学的学位，你仍然需要有向老板证明你对编码感兴趣的项目，Free Code Camp 为我提供了这样的平台。它已经都为你安排好了————你只需要沿着学习路径一路走下去！
之前我是一个全职教学设计师，没有开发经历。Free Code Camp 帮助我得到了作为 JavaScript 开发人员的工作。
Free Code Camp 已经成为我的软件开发职业生涯的主要贡献者之一。我从 app 分析师做起，利用业余和周末的时间，花了三个月认真学习课程。我刚刚找到了一份商业系统开发者的工作。
Free Code Camp 给了我申请软件工程工作的信心，因为我知道了我有学习的能力。这份信心让招聘经理录用了我。
我被公司老板———— 一位拥有 25 年 web 开发经验的程序员————雇佣了。我大学得到的是英语专业的学位，在加入 FreeCodeCamp 之前没有任何编程经验。
Free Code Camp 非常棒，它为我提供了我所需要的、能让我更加深入地完成工作项目的全栈开发技术的直接途径。
Free Code Camp 在我学习编码的过程中为我提供了系统的体系与明确的方向。
除了我在 Free Code Camp 上学习全栈 web 开发这一事实外，它还给了我领导本地社区项目的机会。
我喜欢边学边实践，虽然书本内容非常丰富，却是读得多实践少。后来与 Free Code Camp 不期而遇，它让我边学边动手实践。与之前的拼命学习相反，我现在不只学习，而且一边学习一边开发一些很酷的项目。
我是一名软件质量保证工程师，Free Code Camp 帮助我理解了开发人员的日常工作。
Bonfires 真的让我思考并创造性地结合编程的概念。
使用 Free Code Camp 学习编程让我的职业生涯如虎添翼，它训练我的大脑用电脑的逻辑来思考，这对数字取证领域有着巨大的帮助。
我在编程能力方面取得了巨大的进步————之前根本不会，现在足够获得前端开发职位的面试机会。
现在我可以非常自信地告诉客户我能为他们设计网站。
Free Code Camp 提供了结构化的学习体验，相比其他免费学习网站，它更接近于真实的课堂。我最近受雇升级并维护当地医生办公室的网站，有额外收入和经历的感觉真是美妙。
我是一家创业公司的联合创始人。我们曾经一直使用 PHP 来编程，但总想换成 meteor.js。Free Code Camp 给了我结构化的 JavaScript 指导。
Free Code Camp 让我在很多方面受益，包括自学的机会、鼓励性的环境。真高兴能成为这个成长中的社区中的一员，通过它建立职业生涯的长久联系并创造我所追求的生活方式。
我发现 Free Code Camp 比我的硕士学位更有用，所以我选择从大学退学。学了这么多内容，还节省了$50,000。
I’m re-designing a site for my full-time job.

The guided and structured lessons have been really helpful, as has the relatively slow pace that new concepts are introduced. I had been taking a Udemy course and it really seemed to be skimming the surface of JavaScript in the interest of "getting to everything."
I can learn to code with support by my side. Everyone is so helpful and it makes learning to code less of a struggle.

Free Code Camp has helped me gain the confidence to automate part of my work responsibilities. I was able to use skills I learned from Free Code Camp to help with writing a bash script to search through mobile app database log files to find errors.

There is an active community (even in Manila) and it’s interactive, unlike all the MOOCs I tried before where I had to listen to somebody speak for a long time. I am learning a lot here and I have not yet lost my momentum.
I discovered a coding partner through the Free Code Camp groups who has been able to cover gaps for my client work.

Free Code Camp enables me as a digital marketer to dive right into whatever asset or content and fix things that haven’t been working, as well as roll up my sleeves when our web developers are not available.

Even though I am still just a high school student. The startup I intern for said that if I finish the full track of Free Code Camp, they will strongly consider me for their programming jobs. Thanks Free Code Camp!
I want to be able to freelance and create dynamic websites. Free Code Camp makes that more of a reality for me, as I cannot afford an expensive bootcamp while getting my Master’s degree.
Free Code Camp has been a great experience. I’ve learned so many things. I am in the process of transitioning from content developer to full stack developer.
I like self-paced learning, so Free Code Camp has been great. The challenges are difficult enough to push boundaries but not so tough to scare people off.
Free Code Camp is inspiring me to overhaul some of my old open source projects using more modern approaches and technologies.
Free Code Camp has given me a great, goal oriented curriculum to learn exactly what I was looking for. And best of all it’s 100% free!
I just graduated university, so my financial status is pretty meager, however this camp has definitely helped me improve my skills.
Free Code Camp has given me a free, online opportunity to study full stack JavaScript in a structured, community-based format. I am very grateful for this opportunity.
Great learning opportunity. Good coding challenges and I’m meeting some very motivated people.
Free Code Camp is helpful because it’s not 100% hand-holding, and it pushes me out of my comfort zone.
Free Code Camp has given me the confidence that I need when heading into high level client meetings and developer scrum sessions.
The community is very helpful, and I have already accomplished so much more than what I did with other self-guided courses.
Aside from learning to code in a fun way, I also know I’m not alone and have somewhere to go when I do get stuck and need help.
The thorough curriculum helped a lot in managing my company’s website.
I like that it isn’t just a 9 week course. The chat room and partner coding were also very helpful.

Free Code Camp has helped me learn JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap as well as helped me brush up on my HTML and CSS skills. I was laid off from Boeing in April. I’m hoping to land a job as a JavaScript developer as I get closer to finishing the curriculum. I wish I had known about Free Code Camp sooner.

Free Code Camp is helping my career. I work with developers and I’m beginning to understand their world better. I can phrase questions more clearly, and begin to guess what an issue might be related to.
I’ve long been looking for a place that could keep me interested in learning how to code. I’ve tried several Codecademy and comparable places, but none have proven as engaging as Free Code Camp.

Free Code Camp has given me a strong foundational advantage into pursuing a career in software/web development, and has also served as a great platform for connecting with others who share the same passion for software engineering.

As a jack-of-all-trades at a small educational software company, I’m already putting my coding skills to work, beginning to submit my own pull requests for bug fixes instead of just opening a problem ticket and waiting for someone else to fix it.
Free Code Camp has helped me create and maintain a website for a local bioinformatics conference.
I’ve made connections with people I never would have approached before Free Code Camp.
The coding exercises helped me to prepare for my first job interview.

Free Code Camp has made me more comfortable with certain aspects of code and helped me review and understand concepts in a more hands-on style. Some people learn by reading theory, I don’t understand things until I’ve made them work myself!
I learned more using Free Code Camp in three months than I ever could have at a traditional university.
The exercises helped me hone my skills and get an internship at a tech startup. My projects were a great talking point in the interview, showing them what I did and how I approached the problems.
I'm doing Free Code Camp to transition from mainframe programming to front end development.

The layout, pacing, and resources of Free Code Camp have given me focus and shown me a path to mastery. Just being able to tell people in my field that I’m learning full stack JavaScript and having projects to show for it has been immensely helpful.
I am still in school, pursuing an AS in web development. The JavaScript course in college was a breeze thanks to Free Code Camp.
I've been able to build tools that has helped moved my current career further and has opened up many more doors in the field.
Free Code Camp helped me get to the point as a programmer that I felt confident enough to apply for tech jobs. I got the third one I interviewed for.
I can learn web development at my own pace, which is great with my crazy life’s schedule. It also doesn’t cost $10k-$17k, which I just can’t fork over right now.
I learned to build websites, which is now a new service I offer to local businesses.
Free Code Camp has been nothing but supportive and helpful, taking me from a rather basic knowledge of front end technologies to a better, more complete understanding from a full stack perspective.
Free Code Camp has given me confidence that I can become a web developer.
My resume has been bolstered by adding a completely new stack, providing value to my clients and opening up the pool of potential clients that I would have otherwise referred to peers.
Free Code Camp is helping me learn web development when I can’t afford to go back to school.
Free Code Camp helped me add skillsets to my resume that show experience instead of knowledge without practical application.
Free Code Camp has given me the courage to open the door to the idea of programming for a career.

I am now able to add customized branding and layouts to web applications that fellow employees and customers use everyday. I’m now looking to move away from desktop support and into development roles.
I currently work in a support role for a tech startup. The more I learn about JavaScript, the more I’m able to contribute to a product I really believe in!
I finally feel like I can learn to code in my own time and progress to the point of employability.
